sections.title: Introduction (Wide Shot)
sections.content: Welcome to the Linear Algebra series! I'm Jihad Al Sayed, and today we're starting with one of the most fundamental concepts in all of math and computer science — solving systems of linear equations.

sections.title: What Are Linear Systems?
sections.content: A linear system is just a collection of linear equations. You're trying to find values for variables like x and y that satisfy all equations at once.

sections.title: Substitution Method
sections.math:
\begin{aligned}
 x + y &= 5 \\
 x - y &= 1 \\
 x &= y + 1 \\
 (y + 1) + y &= 5 \\
 2y + 1 &= 5 \Rightarrow y = 2 \\
 x &= 3
\end{aligned}

sections.title: Matrix Representation
sections.math: Ax = b, \text{ where } A = \begin{bmatrix} 1 & 1 \\ 1 & -1 \end{bmatrix},\ x = \begin{bmatrix} x \\ y \end{bmatrix},\ b = \begin{bmatrix} 5 \\ 1 \end{bmatrix}

sections.title: Recap
sections.content: We covered what linear systems are, how to solve them using substitution and elimination, and how they’re represented in matrix form.
